title: scan view
custom_preconds:
Given the user wants to check out what his/her ticket/s looks like on the app
And the user is on the scan view for that ticket
custom_steps:
NOTE: 
Make sure to check that all post season event titles are displayed in the shortened name

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user owns a post season ticket
And the user is on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- unique background for that specific ballpark or type of ticket(parking or seating)
- header (home team icon, account holder name and number, close button)
- barcode/qr code directly below the "header"
- event description (ALCS Home Game 1, NL or AL wild card, etc...)
- event matchup information(the away team will display TBD if the team has not been set for some post season tickets)
- event game time
- section, row, and seat information
- buyer type(optional)
- footer(forward icon, timestamp, info button)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user inspects the footer on the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following information:
- when the ticket was last updated(displayed at mm/dd 4:13pm ET /n ticket 1 of 3)

custom_steps_separated.content:
when the user navigates from ticket list view to the scan view
And the user's device brightness is not at maximum prior to navigating to the scan view
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the device's brightness maxed out as soon as the scan view loads
And the user should be able to clearly see the scan view and all information on that view
And the user should see the device's brightness return back to normal after navigating away from the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the scan view
And the user taps on the information button on the footer
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the "back" of the ticket
And it will contain the following items
- header (will just be a blank header with an X button on the top right)
- address of the ballpark
- phone number of the ballpark
- terms and conditions
- rain check
- warning information
- important notices

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the X button on the back of the ticket
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will be brought back to the scan view

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user owns only 1 ticket for that event
And the user swipes to the left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then nothing should happen

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user owns more then 1 ticket for that event
And the user swipes to the left or right
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to swipe through all the ticket he/she owns

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user swipes to the right until he hits his last ticket
And the user swipes 1 more time to the right
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should return to his first ticket
And the user should be able to do this repeatedly(in both directions)

title: forward detail
custom_preconds:
Given the user has forwarded a post season ticket
And the user is on the forward detail view
custom_steps:
NOTE: 
Make sure to check that all post season event titles are displayed in the shortened name

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user forwarded a post season ticket
And the ticket has not been accepted yet
And the user is on the forward detail view for that transaction (pending)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- event matchup information(the away team will display TBD if the matchup has not been decided)
- event description(will contain series info - "NLCS game 1", "NL Wild card", "NLDS game 1", ETC.......)
- game time (the game's time can display TBD if its not set, test for both)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user forwarded a post season ticket
And the ticket has been accepted
And the user is on the forward detail view for that transaction (completed)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- event matchup information(the away team will display TBD if the matchup has not been decided)
- event description(will contain series info - "NLCS game 1", "NL Wild card", "NLDS game 1", ETC.......)
- game time (the game's time can display TBD if its not set, test for both)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user forwarded a post season ticket
And the ticket was either recalled after it was accepted or not accepted
And the user is on the forward detail view for that transaction (cancelled)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- event matchup information(the away team will display TBD if the matchup has not been decided)
- event description(will contain series info - "NLCS game 1", "NL Wild card", "NLDS game 1", ETC.......)
- game time (the game's time can display TBD if its not set, test for both)

title: ticket list view
custom_preconds: Given the user has purchased or received post season tickets
custom_steps:
NOTE: 
Make sure to check that all post season event titles are displayed in the shortened name

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on the ticket list view
And the user checks the information displayed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the following:
- event matchup information (away team will display tbd if the matchup has not been set)

title: ticket dashboard
custom_preconds:
Given the user is on the ticket dashboard
And Post season began
custom_steps:
NOTE: 
Make sure to check that all post season event titles are displayed in the shortened name

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks the event module on ticket dashboard
And the away team is set
And the date is set
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following on next event module:
- event matchup should display normally with team logo and team names
- the series game info should display directly below the event match up (NLCS Game 1)
- the date and time should appear normally with the ballpark the event is taking place

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks the event module on ticket dashboard
And the away team is not set
And the date is not set
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following on next event module:
- event matchup should be display TBD for the away team and the team logo should be replaced with a placeholder
- the series game info should display directly below the event match up (NLCS Game 1)
- the date and time should display TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks the next home games module on ticket dashboard
And the away team is set
And the date is set
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following on the Next home games module
- should display next set of post season series games
- each cell should display as norm, but the series info should display in between the date and matchup information
- the match up information should display normally
- the time should display normally

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user checks the next home games module on ticket dashboard
And the away team is not set
And the date is not set
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the following on the Next home games module
- should display next set of post season series games
- each cell should display series information (ALCS game 1)
- the date, away team, time should display TBD

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user enters Postseason mode
and navigates to a team where their opponent has not been determined
and taps on the Game Details section
and views the Event Detail page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Team that has already been determined on the right
and there will be a circle TBD logo to the left side of the page
and the matchup will read (for example) "TBD vs. Red Sox"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user enters Postseason mode
and navigates to a team where their opponent has not been determined
and goes to the Tickets dashboard of that tame
and views the event details cell
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will see the Home Team that has already been determined on the right
and there will be a circle TBD logo to the left side of the page
and the matchup will read (for example) "TBD vs. Red Sox"

and selects that stadium from the list of ballparks
and then game is not in a final state
and when further actions are taken
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see that game displaying as the next game at that ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigates to any Wild Card playoff game
and successfully checks into this game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then verify the check in will be recorded on the server
and the game is recorded as game_type="F"

To check the server for a specific user, obtain the users Identity Point utilizing Oracle > then open the attached file, "checkin ws test form.html" > Enter the users ID Point into the "Checkin History:" section > hit submit and verify

Change YEAR accordingly to verify game_type through the lookup service: http://qa.mlb.com/lookup/named.schedule_series.bam?season=*YEAR*&sport_code='mlb'&game_type='D'&game_type='L'&game_type='W'&game_type='F' > this can be used as a double check

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user has navigated to any Wild Card playoff game
and successfully checked into this game
and views the event detail page of that specific game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the 'Video Highlights' section 
and the text should read, "View All Highlights"
and the user should be able to open up the video highlight section successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
Record what the users stats are prior to running this test case

When a user has navigated to a Wild Card playoff game
and successfully checks into this game
and is on their Journal
and taps on the 'Stats' section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the users stats increase by 1 in the 'Career Visits' section (compared to what their stats were prior to checking in)
and the users stats increase by 1 in the 'Ballparks Visited' if they haven't visited that ballpark yet
and their team stats update upon completion of the game in question
